TopicTitle: Trying to locate certain mods. Please assist! Thanks.

Articles.Content:
I'm looking for mods with the folowing functionality:

- Expanded ship assembly building, removing height limit.

- Subassembly Loader thingy. I forget its actual name...

- Space station parts mod that allows me to hard-dock components together with less concern for flexing when maneuvering the space station in orbit. (The vanilla docking ports flex way too much and I worry about it, you know...flying apart.)

- Mod Manager thingy if possible. The one I downloaded does not work at all.

- Anything else you would recommend.

Thank you for your help, guys. KSP is awesome. :3

- Editor Extensions

- Subassembly

- Have to find one yourself, I can't find Quantum Struts on the forum

- Module Manager (unless you're wanting some sort of auto-installer, in which case I can't help you.)

The only mod anyone actually needs: Chatterer

You might also want to consider Universe Replacer; check the thread for texture packs.

here is the link to the quantum-strut

if u r a Windows user u could use KSP Mod Admin to install and manage mods

if u have any problems with this just let me know and i try to fix it!

i would recomment:

Mission Controller Extended

ISA MepSat

Kethane

Tried to get Quantum Struts to work, doesn't appear to be functional at all. The parts are refusing to turn on. Unless they're supposed to turn on when docked?

Nvm, it works. XD

Edited August 10, 2013 by NKato

If you don't like docking, you can use this. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/36379-Plugin-Parts-0-21-0-Orbital-Rendezvous-and-Docking-Assistant-%28ORDA%29-v1-0-8-1

It is from around the days when docking wasn't even in the game, but it still performs it's job perfectly

Universe Replacer

Everything from custom skyboxes to custom EVA suits, fake clouds, higher res planets, and did you want to write your name on eve? Then this is the mod for you!

EDIT: Oh wait... It was already suggested... SÃƒÂ¥rry!

There's one thing I'm having trouble with. I want to place payloads into my shuttle's cargo bay (parts from B9), but there isn't a way to solidly secure the payload, much less put it into the bay. Especially in VAB mode.

KAS is not useful for this, either. :\

Edited August 11, 2013 by NKato

Quantum struts again. You need to use a decoupler or a docking port to secure one end or the bottom or something, and then strut it to the floor. You could probably do that with ordinary struts, thinking about it.
I prefer docking struts to quantum, but that hasn't been updated for a while, at least, not since I last checked.

I managed to get KAS installed to the ship. So now I can stow things in there. But I need to figure out a configuration that lets me keep the payload stable. Currently, it's mounted axially, and it acts like a gyroscope whenever it starts spinning, causing the ship to lose control.
